title: Bystander effect helping strangers in a city park

content.question: One afternoon on a walk, Toni and his friend stopped to help a person lying on a cement sidewalk on a busy street. Just the day before, Toni walked right by a different stranger on the grass in a city park. Which of the following best explains Toni’s helping behavior for each of these scenarios?

choices.label: Toni helped the person they perceived needed assistance.
Tony feels guilty when he doesn’t help others in need.
Tony did not know how to help the person on the grass, but he knew how to help the person on the sidewalk.
Tony felt less risk in helping the person on the sidewalk than he did the person on the grass.

content.answer: Toni helped the person they perceived needed assistance.

skill.text: 1.B: Explain how cultural norms, expectations, and circumstances, as well as cognitive biases apply to behavior and mental processes.
